alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 5:22PM MDT until June 26 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Montana, including the following county, Fergus. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen between 420 pm and 520 pm. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area between 520 pm and 620 pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Fergus County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
